noteParagraph.text: Definitions for Section C:
Alkali metals: Li, Na, K, Rb, Cs, Fr
Alkaline earth metals: Ca, Sr, Ba, Ra
Lanthanides: elements with atomic numbers 57 to 71 inclusive
Rare earths: Sc, Y, Lanthanides
Actinides: elements with atomic numbers 89 to 103 inclusive
Refractory metals: Ti, V, Cr, Zr, Nb, Mo, Hf, Ta, W
Halogens: F, Cl, Br, I, At
Noble gases: He, Ne, Ar, Kr, Xe, Rn
Platinum group: Os, Ir, Pt, Ru, Rh, Pd
Noble metals: Ag, Au, Platinum group
Light metals: alkali metals, alkaline earth metals, Be, Al, Mg
Heavy metals: metals other than light metals
Iron group: Fe, Co, Ni
Non-metals: H, B, C, Si, N, P, O, S, Se, Te, noble gases, halogens
Metals: elements other than non-metals
Transition elements: elements with atomic numbers 21 to 30 inclusive, 39 to 48 inclusive, 57 to 80 inclusive, 89 upwards
This class does not include mechanical features provided for elsewhere, e.g. mechanical working , mechanical aspects of coating, e.g. applying glazes by brushing, dipping, spraying, , kilns .

titlePart.entryReference: in or for production of metals ,

titlePart.text: Mixtures thereof with hydraulic additives, e.g. Portland cement
containing blast-furnace slag, e.g. cements ready-made in the blast furnace
Cements from mineral residues or waste
from raw materials containing flue dust
Fats, fatty oils, fatty acids or salts thereof
Manufacture of hydraulic cements in general
Additives for influencing the burning process
Addition of substances, e.g. during grinding
Cements setting in a similar manner
Magnesium cements containing chlorides, e.g. Sorel cement
Magnesium cements containing sulphates, nitrates, phosphates, or fluorides
Cements containing metals other than magnesium, e.g. zinc, lead
Regeneration of set plaster of Paris
Mortar specially adapted for coating purposes
made from siliceous raw materials, e.g. trass mixed with quick-lime
Artificial stone, e.g. concrete, based on hydraulic cements
Light artificial stone, e.g. light concrete
Mortars based on magnesium or similarly setting cements
Manufacture of articles, e.g. floorings, artificial stone
Mortar specially adapted for coating purposes
based on sulphur, sulphides, or selenium
by using mixed fillers of different diameters
Artificial stone formed from inorganic material, other than slag, bound with small quantities of organic binding agents
Artificial stone containing pigments or colouring substances
from inorganic fillers with inorganic acids or salts
Compounding ingredients used as fillers for mortars, concrete, artificial stone, cements or abrasive bodies
Abrasive fillers, e.g. carbides, nitrides, borides, diamond
Preparing or treating the raw materials individually or as batches
Manufacture of porcelain or white ware
Shaped ceramic products characterised by their composition
titlePart.entryReference: articles characterised by particular shape, see the relevant classes

noteParagraph.text: Compositions are classified according to the constituent present in the highest proportion by weight.

titlePart.text: based on silicates other than clay
with nickel oxide as the principal oxide
with cobalt oxide as the principal oxide
with manganese oxide as the principal oxide
based on titanium oxides or titanates
titlePart.entryReference: containing also zirconium oxide or zirconates

titlePart.text: based on zirconium oxide or zirconates
containing also titanium oxides or titanates
based on borides, nitrides or silicides
by processes involving a melting step
Reaction sintering of free metal or free Si containing compositions
Refractory mortars or materials for tamping, including those whether or not containing clay
Ceramic products containing macroscopic reinforcing agents
titlePart.entryReference: containing free metal other than as macroscopic reinforcing agents

titlePart.text: Fibres, filaments, whiskers, platelets, or the like

titlePart.entryReference: for mortar, concrete, artificial stone, cements or abrasive bodies

titlePart.text: Fibres, filaments, whiskers, platelets, or the like
Joining burned ceramic articles with other burned ceramic articles or other articles by heating

noteParagraph.text: The products classified in this group are also classified in sub-class .

titlePart.text: After-treatment of artificial stone or ceramics
Sound or thermal insulating material not covered elsewhere
on bast fibres, e.g. straw, reeds
